DataElement.preferredName: CAncer Rehabilitation Evaluation System for Research 38 How Much Past Month Embarrassed to Show Body Because of Illness Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Persons' stated observation of how much in the past month, including today, they have been embarrassed to show their bodies to others because of their illness, using a five point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Cancer Rehabilitation Evaluation System for Research Quantity Past Month Embarrassed to Show Body Because of Illness Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A self-reported, clinically relevant instrument designed to assess the rehabilitation needs and daily problems of patients with cancer._How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number._Before the present time._One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks._A question about whether an individual is embarrassed to show their body to others because of their illness._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number.
One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.

Concepts.longName: Embarrassed to Show Body Because of Illness
Concepts.definition: A question about whether an individual is embarrassed to show their body to others because of their illness.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.
